intro: Matthiola fruticulosa, commonly known as the shrub stock, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, which bloom in early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, while its roots are fibrous and adapted to dry conditions. Matthiola fruticulosa is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
